PW Capital Area Transit System -- 3.5 Mills - Board of "CATS" - 12 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Capital Area Transit System ("CATS"))

Summary:  3.5 mills property tax for a period of 12 years for the purpose of providing funds for the operation, maintenance and improvement of the Capital Area Transit System within the Parish of East Baton Rouge.
Race.FullText: Shall the Capital Area Transit System ("CATS"), under the provisions of Article VI, Section 30 of the Louisiana Constitution of 1974, Chapter 10 of Title 48 of the Revised Statutes of Louisiana (R.S. 48:1451-61 as re-enacted in 2005), and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be authorized to levy and collect, and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, of a special tax of three and one-half (3.5) mills on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to taxation within the boundaries of the Parish of East Baton Rouge for a period of twelve (12) years, beginning with the tax collection for the year 2011, and annually thereafter to and including the year 2022.  Eleven Million Three Hundred Fifteen Thousand Five Hundred Dollars ($11,315,500) is reasonably expected to be collected in the first year of the tax. The proceeds of said tax to be used entirely and exclusively for the purpose of providing funds for parishwide transit services and parishwide para-transit services; fixed route and circulator capital improvements and acquisitions and operations; transit amenities, including transit, pedestrian and bicycle improvements and beautification; and including all operating and maintenance costs in connection therewith?

Race.SpecificTitle: Downtown Develop. Dist. -- 10 Mills - Metro Council - 5 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Downtown Development District Proposition

Summary:  Continuation of a special property tax of ten (10) mills, for a period of five (5) years, to provide funds for planning, development, management, operation and improvement purposes within the boundaries of the Downtown Development District of the City of Baton Rouge.
Race.FullText: Shall the Metropolitan Council of the Parish of East Baton Rouge and City of Baton Rouge, acting as governing authority of the Downtown Development District of the City of Baton Rouge, under the provisions of Article VI, Sections 19 and 30 of the 1974 Louisiana Constitution, Part I of Chapter 6 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended (La. R.S. 33:2740.8), and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to continue to levy and collect, and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, of a special ad valorem tax of ten (10) mills on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to taxation within the boundaries of the Downtown Development District of the City of Baton Rouge (the "Tax") (an estimated $436,000 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for a period of five (5) years, beginning with the tax collection for the year 2012, and annually thereafter to and including the year 2016, and shall the proceeds of said Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary expenses of collecting and administering the Tax, if any), be used entirely and exclusively for the planning, development, management, operation and improvement of the facilities, public improvements and services of the Downtown Development District of the City of Baton Rouge?

Race.SpecificTitle: Pride Fire Protection Dist.No.8 -- $32 srv.chrg.-Metro Council-10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Pride Fire Protection District No. 8 Proposition

Summary:  Continuation of the $32.00 per annum service charge for a period of ten (10) years to provide funds for fire protection purposes within the Pride Fire Protection District No. 8 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana.
Race.FullText: Shall the Pride Fire Protection District No. 8 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana, under the provisions of Article VI, Section 19 of the 1974 Louisiana Constitution, Section 1502.1 of Title 40 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended (La. R.S. 40:1502.1), and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be authorized to continue to levy and collect, and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, of a service charge of $32.00 per annum (the "Service Charge") (an estimated $40,000 is reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Service Charge for an entire year), for each residential or commercial structure, whether occupied or unoccupied, located wholly or partly within the boundaries of the Pride Fire Protection District No. 8 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana (which Service Charge shall be levied after the expiration of the service charge approved by the voters in the Pride Fire Protection District No. 8 on November 7, 2000), in each calendar year, for a period of ten (10) years, commencing in the year 2012 to and including the year 2021, and shall the avails or proceeds of the Service Charge (after paying the reasonable and necessary expenses of collection and administering the Service Charge, if any) be used entirely and exclusively for fire protection purposes within the Pride Fire Protection District No. 8 of the Parish of East Baton Rouge, State of Louisiana?
